word: AT THE TURN OF THE CENTURY, SEVENTH-DAY ADVENTISTS IN SOME PARTS OF THE UNITED STATES, LARGELY AS THE RESULT OF ELLEN WHITE'S COUNSEL, WERE JUST MOVING INTO THE ESTABLISHMENT OF CHURCH SCHOOLS FOR THE CHILDREN OF GRADE-SCHOOL AGE. AT 6:00 A.M. ON MONDAY, JULY 14, 1902, ELLEN WHITE ADDRESSED THE MEMBERS OF THE SANITARIUM CHURCH, URGING THE ESTABLISHMENT OF A CHURCH SCHOOL, AND AS AN INCENTIVE OFFERED TO PROVIDE THE USE OF A NEARBY PORTION OF HER LAND AT ELMSHAVEN FOR THE PROJECT. EXCERPTS FROM THE TIMELY ADDRESS SHE GAVE OPEN THIS SECTION.
